channel.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
channel.description:
hey guys, how do I make it so you need 1000 tokkul to open a shop??? or how do i how the price of an item from coins to tokkul???
Thanks for your help, i am pretty bad at this stuff so i need you guys :P
Thanks.

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

Null > Ziege Terra 117

Lol…

Anyway, I still have the same trouble with the code… If i get no errors, then it opens the shop even if I don’t have 1000 tokkul. Man, when i get 15 rep, i am giving it to you

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

Hmm, thanks Telenim, my friend had trouble too, he said he is not that good at it… But I am almost clueless when it comes to ‘more difficult’ coding… that is why I asked for help. Anyways, like i said, help would be really appreciated, I have tried what people have told me, but I get errors and are unsure how to fix them… I would rep++ Telenim if i could, but help is appreciated… if you help me get this right i will… well i will do nothing, just thank you.

PS: I love it how you guys are using this post as a thread for pointless and hilarious spam ^^

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Ziege Terra 117, post:5, topic:285332”]It still opens… I don’t know what the problem is, I’ll show you my current code:

if (NPCID == 2621) { PutNPCCoords = true; if(playerHasItem(6529, 1000)); WanneShop = 14; } else if (playerHasItem(6529, 999));[/quote]

You only checked for the NPC, which is why it didn’t work. As Telenim posted, you need to open and close your if statement within the NPC if statement.

[quote=“Jc22493, post:16, topic:285332”][quote author=Telenim link=topic=377084.msg2840356#msg2840356 date=1245936863]
Yeah, and you’re still asian.
[/quote]
Asian > Telenim.[/quote]
Logic > Asian > Everyone

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:9, topic:285332”][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=377084.msg2840250#msg2840250 date=1245922561]

Don’t edit this or anything place it exactly under the top one you have.

else if (NPCID == 2621) { PutNPCCoords = true; if(playerHasItem2(6529, >= 1000) { return true; WanneShop = 14; } else if (playerHasItem2(5529, < 1000) { return false; sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul to enter this shop."); }
Do not edit it at all and tell me if there are errors.

Not every server would have the variable “PlayerHasItem2”.
[/quote]Did I say they would? And honestly do you have to say that everytime someone offers a code? “Not every server would have the variable “*” you know.”

It really does piss alot of people off, as they already KNOW.[/quote]
Sorry to flame, well not really flaming, but I must correct you. Every source has ‘*’. It isn’t a variable; it’s a multiplicative operator.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

hey man, I get a few errors in my compiler… just saying ‘else’ without ‘if’ and stuff like that… this is it:

client.java:13199: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return true; ^ client.java:13202: cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

And I really appreciate your help so far… But this is kind of important… Thanks so much :P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2009, 03:43:28 am[/size][hr]And Jayden, i deleted the ‘2’ at the end of that… so you don’t have to worry…

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

It still opens… I don’t know what the problem is, I’ll show you my current code:

if (NPCID == 2621) { PutNPCCoords = true; if(playerHasItem(6529, 1000)); WanneShop = 14; } else if (playerHasItem(6529, 999));

if i put the return it says my faceNPC code is an unreachable statement… but it still doesn’t work, and is that code you gave me supposed to go under my WanneShops??? cause that might be the the problem, thanks so much so far…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make requirments for shops?

item.title: How do I make requirments for shops?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Probably use something like this instead of } else {

} else if (playerHasItem2(5529, < 999) { return false; sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul to enter this shop."); }

I’m not that good writing this sort of stuff from scratch but if you can’t get it right I’ll have a go, also I’m not sure 5529, < 999 will work, just take out the ‘<’ but it will only work if you have exactly 1,000 tokkul no higher or lower, if the ‘<’ works with the bottom part add a ‘>’ in the middle of 5529, > 1000 so it looks like that, and add “return true;” right before the WanneShop ID (make a new line above it)

Actually I think I found a way to change coins into tokkul for certain shops, I’ll post in a second.

Read full topic
